cab.content: SECRET Copy No. 3 2CP. (50) 7921st April, 1950CABINETCOMMITTEE ON THE NATIONAL HEALTH service note by the Prime minister in pursuance of the Cabinefs decision of 6th April (CM. (50) 19th Conclu-sions, Minute 1), I have appointed a Committee with the following terms ofreference : "(1) To fix limits for the total cost of the National Health Service in thefinancial year 1951-52 and succeeding years.(2) To keep under review the course of expenditure on this Service, on thebasis of monthly statements by the Health Departments; and, if thecost seems likely to exceed the limits set for the current year, to deviseappropriate remedies.(3) Generally to assist the Health Ministers in securing due economy in theadministration of this Service."2. I shall myself preside over this Committee and the members will be Lord President.Lord Privy Seal.Minister of Health.Secretary of State for Scotland.Minister of State for Economic Affairs.Minister of National Insurance.Minister of Pensions.Mr. A. Johnston, Cabinet Office, will act as Secretary of the Committee.C. R. A.10, Downing Street. S.W. 1,21st April, 1950.38603Printed for the Cabinet. April 1950
